intro: Anemia anthriscifolia, commonly known as the lesser cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its fern-like, bipinnate leaves that resemble those of the cow parsley. The plant produces small, white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Anemia anthriscifolia is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
